sections.heading: on obtaining consumer's payment
sections.text: It is unlawful for a seller to procure the services of any third-party delivery, courier, or other pickup service to obtain a consumer's payment for goods, unless the goods are delivered and can be inspected.SourceLaws 1999, LB 469, § 5;R.S.1943, (1999), § 86-2005;Law

86-226.Restriction on obtaining consumer's payment.

It is unlawful for a seller to procure the services of any third-party delivery, courier, or other pickup service to obtain a consumer's payment for goods, unless the goods are delivered and can be inspected.

SourceLaws 1999, LB 469, § 5;R.S.1943, (1999), § 86-2005;Laws 2002, LB 1105, § 88.
